data.author: WordSpaghetti
data.content: Cloudbreak Discovery plc, (LSE:CDL) is pleased to provide an update in respect of the three options  and sale and purchase agreements in Western Australia announced during 2025. ·     Darlot West Gold Project (announced 22nd September 2025) - First Option Agreement ·     Darlot West Expansion (announced 24th November 2025) - Second Option Agreement ·     Crofton Gold Project (announced 9th December 2025) - Third Option Agreement The Company is now issuing the required ordinary shares ("New Ordinary Shares") to conclude these acquisitions, resulting in Cloudbreak owning these very exciting gold assets in a top-tier gold jurisdiction. In aggregate, the Company will issue 117 million New Ordinary Shares in satisfaction of the consideration payable under the First Option Agreement, Second Option Agreement, and Third Option Agreement. "We are extremely delighted that we can now conclude the acquisition of these tenements that have provided the Company with such outstanding gold results in the past months and we look forward to reporting many more. The work we have already undertaken on the ground has provided us with enormous optimism for the overall prospectivity of these tenements for gold and we rate their potential for meaningful and commercial discoveries in 2026 as very high. The Darlot area has already provided us with immediate step-up drill targets and now that we will own these tenements outright, we aim to have drill rigs turning this quarter. The closure of these transactions gives the board of Cloudbreak a lot of confidence that we can start delivering real value for shareholders, especially with the gold price environment we find ourselves in at the moment." "The newly issued shares represent an increase of just 8.33% of our current issued share capital" 8.33% for 60.6 square kilometers of prime Australian gold tenemants, where 65g/t gold has been found. Potential JV to come? Just some of the sampling results for Darlot (30/10/25 RNS): "High Tenor of Rock chip results being followed up, returning over 10 g/t include: o  65.75 g/t Au (2.11 ounces of gold per tonne) o  40.44 g/t Au (1.30 ounces of gold per tonne) o  27.23 g/t Au o  19.79 g/t Au o  15.89 g/t Au o  15.40 g/t Au o  14.39 g/t Au o  13.99 g/t Au o  12.66 g/t Au o  12.45 g/t Au o  10.78 g/t Au" Currently waiting overdue assays and likely will arrive shortly. Drilling to start Q1, costs potentially already factored in with the August fundraise long since churned. Future is bright with CDL!

data.content: A junior explorer to gold producer does take on average 15 years but you have to consider many factors along the way. Most explorers especially in the paterson region will only have one course of action and that is to have a toll agreement or farm in opportunities. This region it will be GGP and telfer but all explorers will have to take this action, only recently GGP announcing a farm in agreement with rincon resources to fund further exploration. If you are looking to invest in any gold company particular at this stage of exploration the price will be volatile on drill results up and down so there is money to be made in the short term. Cloudbreak is already up 500% this year alone and I believe will rise further in 2026 as more results are published.

data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: Holding....and topping up slowly Seeing a few posts asking why assays are taking time, so here’s my take for what it’s worth. Delays on assay results are pretty normal, especially in Western Australia when labs are busy. Samples don’t come back one by one, they get batched, checked, sometimes re-run if anything looks unusual. That takes time but it also means the company is being careful rather than rushing half a story out. Worth remembering these aren’t just low-grade soil numbers. When you start seeing rock chips running 20g, 40g, even 65g per tonne, labs and geos tend to slow down, not speed up. High grades get scrutinised hard before anyone puts their name to an RNS. CDL have been consistent in saying assays are pending and they’ve been steadily advancing the project in the meantime. Expanding the land package at Darlot West and locking in ground between two producing mines doesn’t feel like a company trying to hide bad news. Could it still disappoint? Of course, that’s exploration. But a bit of waiting here doesn’t ring alarm bells for me. It feels more like the usual patience tax you pay in this game. I’m happy to sit tight and let the work do the talking. Not advice, just how I’m looking at it. GRM

data.author: Cebo-456
data.content: The price of Gold, Copper, Silver make this a no- brainer. CDL  offers high-upside exposure to gold and base metals exploration in Tier-1 mining jurisdictions ( Western Australia) where historic projects have delivered exceptional grades and exploration potential. Their recent acquisitions, including the Crofton Gold Project with rock chip results up to ~253 g/t gold and ~215 g/t silver, demonstrate the potential for discovering economic mineralisation that could materially enhance valuation if drilling confirms a resource - results from Darlot and Patterson, if good, could make this a mulinillion $ Company overnight - watch this space At Darlot West, surface sampling has returned already returned  very high-grade gold hits (up to ~65 g/t) and the company has expanded its landholding five-fold adjacent to established mining operations that have produced millions of ounces of gold - The market has missed this and/or the Share Price has been deliberatly subdued to allow investors and MM's to make life changing sums of money in the near future . Cloudbreak’s strategy of building a diversified portfolio of high-potential exploration assets and advancing them into drill-ready targets maximises multiple catalysts rather than relying on a single project os a shrewd move and the timing couldnt have been better - they now have several projects, each of which could be worth Hudreds of Millions alone - with the right results. With institutional backing and recent fundraises boosting working capital for exploration, the company is well positioned to deliver regular news flow that will surely rerate the stock as results materialise. Mid tier producers and explorers are now cash-rich - I would expect M&A interest to already be happening , KV and Royalty deals potentially on the horizon or full asset sales or perhaps a complete T/O. I have CDL as a potentail 10-20bagger from those levels in the short to medium term. Just now need the results to come. In a market where gold prices remain elevated and investor appetite for high-growth exploration plays is strong, successful drilling results or resource announcements could produce outsized returns. For risk-tolerant investors seeking early exposure to potential discovery stories with multiple assets and catalysts, Cloudbreak’s evolving portfolio and strategic focus make it a compelling buy.

data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: *** Holding & Topping Up *** Still here, still watching the trades and yesterday was a fascinating one. The stand-out feature: the big blocks moving Across the session we saw: 1,651,645 @ 0.909p (Unknown) 1,045,089 @ 0.958p (Unknown) 1,000,000 @ 0.985p (Unknown) 1,000,000 @ 0.938p (Unknown) Plus multiple 400k–500k buys in the 1.01–1.04p region. It could suggest someone quietly building a line without disturbing the price. Sensible, getting in while the SP is still cheap. Or it could simply be the MMs matching off chunky buy orders with willing sellers. Either way, it looks like steady, non-panicked accumulation. The sells were mostly smaller Most of the selling during the day came in mid-sized blocks: 20k, 40k, 50k, 100k blocks Mostly in the 0.90–0.96p region Sprinkled with tiny £2–£10 “micro trades” The larger sells (such as 333k @ 0.961) were outnumbered by multi-hundred-k buys later on. If anything, the selling looked like thinning out by short-term traders rather than major holders. Micro trades yet again, always makes no apparent sense, who'd buy 94 shares, less that a quid, the commission alone makes it look suss. Those odd little trades, 200 shares here, 300 there look very similar to previous days. Now this could be: Automated market maker balancing Test pings Fractional fills Or simple retail drip-feeding small orders I couldn't tell you which I suspect more if I'm honest. However, no need to automatically assume manipulation, tiny trades often appear when liquidity is active. Price action context We pushed into the 1.00–1.05p range multiple times. Buyers stepped up every time price dipped into the 0.90–0.96p zone, accumulation. The day almost has a “soaking up supply” feel to it, cautiously, that’s often how a base forms before a move. Not a guarantee, just a pattern worth noting. A qietly interesting day. Big blocks still showing up. Sellers appear to be thinning out, supports my theory of holding. No panic anywhere. Buyers happy to pay 1p+. This is important, shows an appetite for risk with this share. And best of all the project news flow hasn’t even restarted yet. The anticipation is the best bit for me, I'm not in any rush. So to sum up, nothing dramatic, just that slow, patient accumulation rhythm you sometimes see when an idea is brewing. Not financial advice, just ramblings while I drink my Dolche Gusto Pod Coffee in bed on a cold, wet, dark Winter morning. Apparently snow is on its way, which will be 👍

data.content: 💯 Bargain entry for some massive GOLD GOLD GOLD deposits Had to buy more before it lifts off back over 1.05 PJ Tom Evans, Cloudbreak's MD, commented; "It is great to be on the ground at Crofton for the Company's maiden site visit and to be looking at where the bonanza grade gold samples up to 253 g/t were taken and historic gold production averaged 150g/t. These grades are exceptionally high and the site trip will validate and expand on previous work completed, where delineation of multiple trends with strike lengths of over a kilometre on the tenement give the Company a vast number of high priority exploration targets. This incredibly exciting gold project in Western Australia adds significantly to our growing portfolio of gold assets in a period of record gold prices and resurgent silver prices."

data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: Gold is sitting at or near record levels, which changes the backdrop for every serious gold explorer. I can see both sides of the debate here. The bulls are rightly focused on the quality of the ground CDL has secured in Western Australia and the genuinely high grades already reported at surface, particularly at Crofton and Darlot West. In a strong gold market, that does matter. At the same time, it’s worth keeping the science straight. An ounce is just a unit of weight, grams are simply a smaller unit of the same thing. High g/t rock chips are encouraging, but they are still surface samples, not a resource. The real value only starts to crystallise once drilling confirms continuity and scale. The bears are also right that this is still early stage, drilling is still to come, and placings are part of exploration whether we like them or not. That’s the price of moving projects forward. For my part, I’ve topped up again today. Not chasing headlines, not trading the swings just backing the location,  the grades so far, and a gold price environment that’s about as supportive as it gets. Happy to wait and see how the story develops over time. DYOR and good luck all

data.title: Multiple Gold Targets identified at Darlot West
data.full_content:
28 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 5850Q
Cloudbreak Discovery PLC
28 January 2026
28 January 2026
Cloudbreak Discovery Plc
('Cloudbreak', or 'the Company')
Multiple Gold Targets identified at Darlot West
Cloudbreak Discovery Plc (LSE: CDL),
a London Stock Exchange Main Market listed company, is pleased to announce that multiple gold targets have been identified from a geological and structural interpretation based on the recently completed high resolution magnetic survey. The interpretation is supported by recent excellent results from the initial trial geochemical soil sampling program and rock chip sampling programs from the Darlot West Gold Project ("Darlot West"), located only 10km southwest of the iconic Darlot Gold Mine in Western Australia with production of 2.8 million ounces of gold produced to date, and 25km north of Northern Star Limited Thunderbox
Gold Mine with annual production of 232koz and resource of 4.7Moz and Reserve of 1.96Moz gold. (
Figure 1
).
The interpretation further validates the Company's view on the potential of the Darlot West Gold Project, and the multiple gold targets identified indicate a similar structural setting to the Darlot Gold Mine. The Darlot/Centenary Sill, the key gold mineralisation event at Darlot, is interpreted to be present at Darlot West. Geological efforts will focus on the interpretation with expansion of the geochemical sampling program over the project area, with the aim of generating multiple vectors for the maiden drill program.
Multiple high tenor rock chip results over 1g/t gold (reported on 24 October 2025) and recovery of gold nuggets from the project (reported on
24 October 2025
), bodes well for future exploration.
High Tenor of Rock chip results over 10 g/t include:
o
65.75 g/t Au (2.11 ounces of gold per tonne)
o
40.44 g/t Au (1.30 ounces of gold per tonne)
o
27.23 g/t Au
o
19.79 g/t Au
o
15.89 g/t Au
o
15.40 g/t Au
o
14.39 g/t Au
o
13.99 g/t Au
o
12.66 g/t Au
o
12.45 g/t Au
o
10.78 g/t Au
Tom Evans, Cloudbreak's MD, commented; "Multiple new gold targets is a great outcome from the high-resolution magnetic interpretation, with the Darlot/Centenary Sill interpreted to also control gold mineralisation at Darlot West, as it does at the Darlot Gold Mine located 10km away. This now gives us a clear path forward to develop this high tenor gold project. A geochemical sampling program will further refine the new and existing targets and add a multiple vector to rank targets and anomalies for maiden drill testing. The gold price continues to hit historical highs and the booming Western Australian gold sector is a great place for Cloudbreak to continue building a portfolio of quality assets. I look forward to updating shareholders as we move towards maiden drilling."
Future plans and work programs:
·
Expand the geochemical sampling grid across the project.
·
Plan for maiden drill program
Figure 1: Location of 60.6km2 Darlot West Gold Project, Western Australia - 10km from 2.8Moz Darlot Gold Mine, and 25km from Thunderbox Gold Mine operated by Northern Star Limited.
Figure 2: Geological and structural interpretation based of high-resolution magnetics, with multiple targets identified.
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended).
-END-
For Further Information, please contact:

Tel: +44 (0) 207 655 6000
Email: corporate@marex.com
About Cloudbreak Discovery PLC
LSE listed Cloudbreak Discovery PLC is a leading gold, precious and base metals resource explorer. Cloudbreak is focused on mineral exploration in Western Australia with the aim of bringing near-term cashflow and driving shareholder value. Through its wholly owned subsidiaries, the Company will develop its array of mineral assets, whilst continuing to generate new projects with a particular focus on commodities with high intrinsic value. Cloudbreak's generative model across the mineral sector enables a multi-asset approach to investing in the commodity cycle.
Competent Persons Statement
The Information in this report that relates to exploration results, mineral resources or ore reserves is based on information compiled by Mr Edward Mead, who is a Fellow of the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy. Mr Mead is a consultant to Cloudbreak Discovery Plc and employed by Doraleda Pty Ltd. Tom Evans, Cloudbreak's MD, commented; "These surface results are outstanding and to see the high tenor of gold grades and now these very exciting silver grades, we are very optimistic of the potential for discovery here at Crofton. Silver and gold prices are now at historic highs, which makes Crofton an very exciting project for the Company."
T
hese assay results confirm the high tenor of the gold mineralisation at Crofton and is now establishing a mathematical relationship between Photon and Fire assay for gold - both of which can be used for JORC reporting purposes - and the multi-element results now confirms the presence of very significant silver grades. From the results received to date, we can now see that silver values are high where we have high gold values, but we can also see silver values where there is no gold. Further exploration on site this quarter will refine the relationship between gold and silver.
Sampling Results
Crofton hosts an approximately 20km2 area of laterally extensive quartz veining hosted within the Yilgalong granite. Quartz veins are commonly 10's of metres wide and can be seen to extend along strike for 100's to 1,000's of metres. A total of 54 samples were taken around locations of previously reported gold results and along strike.
Initial work was focused on sampling areas of historically reported gold mineralisation where grades of up to 253 g/t Au have been historically reported. Gold grades > 1 g/t and up to 162.35 g/t have now been confirmed over a 1km x 4km area. The multi-element results and Fire assay being reported in this release confirm the tenor of gold mineralisation and aslo show the high levels of silver up to 175 g/t Ag. This, paired with historical >25 ppb Au soil anomalism, indicates that the Crofton project warrants immediate follow-up in the form of systematic surface geochemical sampling programs and has the potential to host economic quantities of vein-hosted gold and silver mineralisation.
About the Crofton Gold Project
Crofton hosts a large area of hydrothermal alteration within the Yilgalong Granitoid associated with a suite of prominent quartz veins. Historical exploration has been limited to surface sampling programs of stream sediment, soil and rock chip sampling.
The Company will hold a 100% interest in the Crofton property, which consists of one exploration licence application E45/6690 covering 57km². The Crofton licence covers much of the Boodalyerrie Mining Centre, which has recorded production from 1901 to 1910 of 588.4 ounces gold from 122 tonnes of ore at a reconciled average grade of 150g/t gold.

data.author: Professor1
data.content: An area of 4 km x 1.5 km (6 km²) is a massive surface footprint for such high grades. If mineralization is continuous across even a fraction of this area, the tonnage potential would be world-class. However, rock chip samples are "point data" from the surface. In geological terms, this footprint suggests a large hydrothermal system, potentially an epithermal or mesothermal vein field, where qold-bearing fluids have permeated a wide structural zone. GLA

data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: Gold is sitting at or near record levels, which changes the backdrop for every serious gold explorer. I can see both sides of the debate here. The bulls are rightly focused on the quality of the ground CDL has secured in Western Australia and the genuinely high grades already reported at surface, particularly at Crofton and Darlot West. In a strong gold market, that does matter. At the same time, it’s worth keeping the science straight. An ounce is just a unit of weight, grams are simply a smaller unit of the same thing. High g/t rock chips are encouraging, but they are still surface samples, not a resource. The real value only starts to crystallise once drilling confirms continuity and scale. The bears are also right that this is still early stage, drilling is still to come, and placings are part of exploration whether we like them or not. That’s the price of moving projects forward. For my part, I’ve topped up again today. Not chasing headlines, not trading the swings just backing the location,  the grades so far, and a gold price environment that’s about as supportive as it gets. Happy to wait and see how the story develops over time. DYOR and good luck all

GLA

data.author: Professor1
data.content: An area of 4 km x 1.5 km (6 km²) is a massive surface footprint for such high grades. If mineralization is continuous across even a fraction of this area, the tonnage potential would be world-class. However, rock chip samples are "point data" from the surface. In geological terms, this footprint suggests a large hydrothermal system, potentially an epithermal or mesothermal vein field, where qold-bearing fluids have permeated a wide structural zone. GLA

data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: Gold is sitting at or near record levels, which changes the backdrop for every serious gold explorer. I can see both sides of the debate here. The bulls are rightly focused on the quality of the ground CDL has secured in Western Australia and the genuinely high grades already reported at surface, particularly at Crofton and Darlot West. In a strong gold market, that does matter. At the same time, it’s worth keeping the science straight. An ounce is just a unit of weight, grams are simply a smaller unit of the same thing. High g/t rock chips are encouraging, but they are still surface samples, not a resource. The real value only starts to crystallise once drilling confirms continuity and scale. The bears are also right that this is still early stage, drilling is still to come, and placings are part of exploration whether we like them or not. That’s the price of moving projects forward. For my part, I’ve topped up again today. Not chasing headlines, not trading the swings just backing the location,  the grades so far, and a gold price environment that’s about as supportive as it gets. Happy to wait and see how the story develops over time. DYOR and good luck all

data.author: Professor1
data.content: They have also carried out the PHOTON ASSAY for samples > 1g/tonne. The reason for this is that this increases the confidence in these very high values as photon assay would usually analyse a larger bulk sample and removes the "nugget effect" where gold might have been unevenly spread. GLA

data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: Gold is sitting at or near record levels, which changes the backdrop for every serious gold explorer. I can see both sides of the debate here. The bulls are rightly focused on the quality of the ground CDL has secured in Western Australia and the genuinely high grades already reported at surface, particularly at Crofton and Darlot West. In a strong gold market, that does matter. At the same time, it’s worth keeping the science straight. An ounce is just a unit of weight, grams are simply a smaller unit of the same thing. High g/t rock chips are encouraging, but they are still surface samples, not a resource. The real value only starts to crystallise once drilling confirms continuity and scale. The bears are also right that this is still early stage, drilling is still to come, and placings are part of exploration whether we like them or not. That’s the price of moving projects forward. For my part, I’ve topped up again today. Not chasing headlines, not trading the swings just backing the location,  the grades so far, and a gold price environment that’s about as supportive as it gets. Happy to wait and see how the story develops over time. DYOR and good luck all

data.title: CDL Proceeds with acquisition of Paterson Project
data.full_content:
Today 07:00
RNS Number : 2186S
Cloudbreak Discovery PLC
09 February 2026
9 February 2026
Cloudbreak Discovery Plc
('Cloudbreak', or 'the Company')
CDL Proceeds with acquisition of Paterson Project
Cloudbreak Discovery Plc (LSE: CDL),
a London Stock Exchange Main Market listed company, is pleased to announce that it is proceeding with the acquisition of 90% of the Paterson Gold-Copper-Molybdenum Project, that covers 888km2 in the Paterson Province of Western Australia, located only 40km southwest of the Telfer Gold-Copper Mine operated by Greatland Gold Plc (
Figure 1
).
Highlights:
·
The Paterson Project covers 888km2 of granted Exploration tenure, 40km south west of Greatland Gold Plc's (GGP London and ASX) Telfer Gold Copper Mine. Telfer has produced 15Moz of gold and combined with Havieron hosts a total of 10.2Moz Au in resources.
·
Drilling last completed in 1987 with multiple significant drilling intercepts including:
o
17m @ 1.6% Cu, 317ppm Mo from 84m
(87WDRC2)
▪
Including 9m @ 2.6% Cu, 456ppm Mo
o
9m @ 2.0% Cu, 0.14g/t Au, 272ppm Mo from 84m
(87WDRC6)
▪
Including 5m @3.1% Cu, 0.20g/t Au, 430ppm Mo
o
11m @ 1.5% Cu, 0.10g/t Au, 181ppm Mo from 83m
(87WDRC8)
▪
Including 7m @ 2.1% Cu, 0.15g/t Au, 250ppm Mo
o
13m @ 1.1% Cu, 0.29g/t Au from 107m
(87WDRC14)
▪
Including 6m @ 2.0% Cu, 0.27g/t Au
o
8m @ 0.7% Cu, 310ppm Mo from 98m
(87WDRC7)
▪
Including 1m @ 3.3% Cu, 0.22g/t Au, 560ppm Mo
·
Historic exploration looking for copper not gold
·
Significant drilling intercepts are shallow and can be targeted using reverse circulation ("RC") drilling
·
Multiple geophysical targets identified which are yet to be drill tested
·
Targets associated with magnetic lows and gravity highs
·
Mobile MT, a technique utilised by Wishbone Gold Plc and the Telfer Mine in the Paterson Province, to be used over the Paterson Project area
·
Paterson Project also surrounds the Kintyre Uranium Project owned by global major Cameco Corp. Kintyre hosts a total indicated resource of 53.5Mlb U3O8
Tom Evans, Cloudbreak's MD, commented;
"I am excited and delighted we have been able to proceed with this fantastic opportunity to acquire this asset, in a jurisdiction with significant activity and recent proven success by Wishbone Gold Plc. Located only 40km southwest of the Telfer Gold-Copper Mine operated by Greatland Gold Plc.
Technological advances in geophysics since the 80's have improved greatly with the success of Mobile MT in the Paterson Province, we intend to start off with this geophysical survey, to use as another vector and data layer to refine and rank drill targets not only for copper but for gold as well.
I am excited, for the company and its shareholders, as we progress this great opportunity and I look forward to updating the market as our exploration programs progress."
Location
The Paterson Project (
Figure 1
) directly surrounds the Kintyre Uranium Deposit and is located 40km south-south-west of Greatland Gold Plc's Telfer Gold-Copper Mine.
Figure 1: Location Plan
Exploration Completed
The Wanderer Prospect (
Figure 2 and 3
) was drilled between 1987 and 1990 by CRA (at significantly lower prevailing copper and gold prices) as part of its uranium exploration expenditure across its nearby Kintyre Project. The majority of drilling was only drilled to 100m from the surface, with multiple holes logged as ending in mineralisation. No follow
‐
up drilling has occurred in the 35 years since then. Forty-two drill holes were drilled at the Wanderer Prospect on E45/5358 tenement.
Multiple significant drilling intercepts include:
·
17m @ 1.6% Cu, 317ppm Mo from 84m (87WDRC2)
o
Including 9m @ 2.6% Cu, 456ppm Mo
·
9m @ 2.0% Cu, 0.14g/t Au, 272ppm Mo from 84m (87WDRC6)
o
Including 5m @3.1% Cu, 0.20g/t Au, 430ppm Mo
·
11m @ 1.5% Cu, 0.10g/t Au, 181ppm Mo from 83m (87WDRC8)
o
Including 7m @ 2.1% Cu, 0.15g/t Au, 250ppm Mo
·
13m @ 1.1% Cu, 0.29g/t Au from 107m (87WDRC14)
o
Including 6m @ 2.0% Cu, 0.27g/t Au
·
8m @ 0.7% Cu, 310ppm Mo from 98m (87WDRC7)
o
Including 1m @ 3.3% Cu, 0.22g/t Au, 560ppm Mo
Figure 2: Wanderer Prospect Drill Section
Figure 3: Wanderer Prospect- Drill Collar Plan and Mineralised Trend
Tenure
The Project consists of three granted exploration licences E45/5358, E45/5391 and E45/6244 covering a land area of 888km2.
The ground is contiguous to the west of the Cottesloe base-metal project held by Wishbone Gold Plc.
Regional Geology
The Paterson Orogen is a 2,000km long arcuate belt of folded and metamorphosed sedimentary and igneous rocks that range in age from predominantly Palaeoproterozoic to Neoproterozoic with limited outcrops of Archaean rocks.
The eastern margin of the Paterson Orogen is masked by younger Proterozoic to Phanerozoic sedimentary rocks (Officer and Canning Basins) with sedimentary units of the late Proterozoic Savory Basin on-lapping to the southwest. The main outcropping stratigraphic packages across the bulk of the Paterson Project are the lowermost member of the Mesoproterozoic to Neoproterozoic Yeneen

data.author: Professor1
data.content: They have also carried out the PHOTON ASSAY for samples > 1g/tonne. The reason for this is that this increases the confidence in these very high values as photon assay would usually analyse a larger bulk sample and removes the "nugget effect" where gold might have been unevenly spread. GLA

data.author: Professor1
data.content: An area of 4 km x 1.5 km (6 km²) is a massive surface footprint for such high grades. If mineralization is continuous across even a fraction of this area, the tonnage potential would be world-class. However, rock chip samples are "point data" from the surface. In geological terms, this footprint suggests a large hydrothermal system, potentially an epithermal or mesothermal vein field, where qold-bearing fluids have permeated a wide structural zone. GLA

data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: Gold is sitting at or near record levels, which changes the backdrop for every serious gold explorer. I can see both sides of the debate here. The bulls are rightly focused on the quality of the ground CDL has secured in Western Australia and the genuinely high grades already reported at surface, particularly at Crofton and Darlot West. In a strong gold market, that does matter. At the same time, it’s worth keeping the science straight. An ounce is just a unit of weight, grams are simply a smaller unit of the same thing. High g/t rock chips are encouraging, but they are still surface samples, not a resource. The real value only starts to crystallise once drilling confirms continuity and scale. The bears are also right that this is still early stage, drilling is still to come, and placings are part of exploration whether we like them or not. That’s the price of moving projects forward. For my part, I’ve topped up again today. Not chasing headlines, not trading the swings just backing the location,  the grades so far, and a gold price environment that’s about as supportive as it gets. Happy to wait and see how the story develops over time. DYOR and good luck all

data.content: An area of 4 km x 1.5 km (6 km²) is a massive surface footprint for such high grades. data.author: GoldRushMark
data.content: Gold is sitting at or near record levels, which changes the backdrop for every serious gold explorer. I can see both sides of the debate here. The bulls are rightly focused on the quality of the ground CDL has secured in Western Australia and the genuinely high grades already reported at surface, particularly at Crofton and Darlot West. In a strong gold market, that does matter. At the same time, it’s worth keeping the science straight. An ounce is just a unit of weight, grams are simply a smaller unit of the same thing. High g/t rock chips are encouraging, but they are still surface samples, not a resource. The real value only starts to crystallise once drilling confirms continuity and scale. The bears are also right that this is still early stage, drilling is still to come, and placings are part of exploration whether we like them or not. That’s the price of moving projects forward. For my part, I’ve topped up again today. Not chasing headlines, not trading the swings just backing the location,  the grades so far, and a gold price environment that’s about as supportive as it gets. Happy to wait and see how the story develops over time. DYOR and good luck all

company_30s.what_they_do: CDL is a small gold exploration company that acquires and develops gold projects mainly in Western Australia.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Gold mining drives a large global commodity market, and a successful project can bring significant returns to investors and supply the industry.
company_30s.current_state: The firm has just finished several acquisitions and has delivered positive gold assay results. It is still in the exploration stage but is moving toward production and is trading at a very low price.

rns_narrative: The company has been adding assets—Paterson Project, WA Gold Assets, and Darlot West—showing an aggressive expansion strategy.
Positive gold results from Crofton and Darlot West indicate that the projects are commercially viable.
Recent site visits and option exercises suggest that the company is actively working to bring these assets into production.
All of this points to a bottoming process where the market has not yet priced in the progress.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Radio silence – no social chatter at all.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: No bulls left – classic contrarian setup.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Maximum pessimism – the market is ignoring the upside.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: From complete silence to a potential surprise if a catalyst hits.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends are flat – dead trends mean the biggest surprise is still possible.

near_term_catalysts: A drilling result that confirms high gold grades.
A financing round or a new partnership that gives the company the cash to start production.
A formal announcement that the projects will move into the production phase.
A breakout above the recent high with a spike in volume.
